data.title: Bruce Meanings in English, Popularity, Origin
data.meta_description: Bruce is a Christian English baby unisex name. Its meaning is "Brieuse, Well-born, Influential Family". Bruce name origin is English. , Baby names meaning in Urdu, Hindi
data.text:
Bruce Name Meaning in English

What does the name Bruce mean? What is the meaning of the name Bruce, lucky number, lucky stone, origin and religion.

The name Bruce is an English baby name. In English the meaning of the name Bruce is: Thick brush. Surname since medieval times; now a common given name. Folklore tale of 14th century Robert King of Scotland: (the Bruce) who learned the value of perseverance from watching a spider spin a web.

Bruce Name Meaning, Origin & Details

Meaning: Brieuse, well-born, influential family Short Info: Robert the Bruce was a Scottish hero who achieved independence from England for Scotland (14th century AD). Details: From the Celtic, meaning "woods" or "thicket". Originally a family name brought to Scotland by the Normans. Gender: For both boy and girl, unisex, transgender, neutral gender Origin: English Religion: Christian Suitable for: Unisex / Gender neutral Hardness: Easy to pronounce, Bruce is a short name Uniqueness: It is a common name Short & Easy: Yes

Bruce Name Lucky Number 9

Bruce Name Numerology And Personality

Bruce has the numerology 9. The meaning of this name is brieuse, well-born, influential family. People with numerology number 9 are the people who are thought to be very selfless and very kind towards the people and everyone around them. These are the people who are always thinking of others over themselves and they take care of everyone around them.

These people believe in creative expression and that is one reason why they are thought to be very humanitarian. The gender of this name Bruce is Unisex. They always think of what they can do for the humanity.

The religion is christian. These are the people who are very obligatory of everything and they also only believe in giving and you will definitely never find these people in takers because they are always the givers. They do not wait for others to do things for them so that they can do it in return rather they are first one to make a move.
